Half-Life, like a lot of the games from its era, is a powerfully 90s thing. Not so much in terms of aesthetics, as I feel like the game actually has a pretty timeless look to its art design. The technology powering the game, though, and certainly its design, are very much of their time though. That's not a bad thing, of course! It's still a masterpiece of game design, particularly for the period it came out in. This game doubles every technological advancement made by Quake a few years prior, and it feels extremely modern next to pretty much anything else that came out in 1998. 

It's a little clunky and janky, and it certainly shows its age in some places, but Half-Life is a great time nonetheless. If you've got ten bucks burning a hole in your pocket and you just need something classic to play, I can think of way worse games to spend your money on. If nothing else, it's a piece of gaming history that should be played simply for its historical value.

Jdu proti proudu a dávám palec dolů z jednoho prostého důvodu - pohyb. Po 3/4 hodině koukání na rychlobruslení jsem se cítil docela nepříjemně a kdybych tomu dal celou hodinu, tak bych možná hodil tyčku. Taková klasika některých starších her: motion sickness. Kdyby Gordon standardně chodil místo běhání a kdyby se neklouzal jak na zmrzlém rybníku, tak by to asi šlo.

+ díky průběžným aktualizacím zvládá i widescreen režimy (včetně QHD)
+ lékárničky, ukládání, žádné checkpointy apod.

- běhání místo chůze (v nastavení jsem nenašel možnost to trvale přepnout)

for a game that was made before the 21st century, i'm amazed by the depth and how advanced this game was for its time. the fact that the npcs properly follow you and talk to each other and interact with you properly is amazing for a game this old, and honestly, a lot of it still holds up to this day. obviously a classic, and for all the right reasons.

i will say though that some parts of the game were kinda anticlimactic or trite because after a while it felt like the game overstayed its welcome (the surface tension chapter in particular lmao). final boss fight was pretty boring and some enemies got stuck at times, but other than that, i have no complaints.

A gaming classic, I decided to finally play this game after playing HL2 years ago. Although itll take some getting used to, it's a pretty fun game. Some difficult and annoying parts that I recommend a guide for when you get to them, but overall fun.

I recently completed this game here is my opinions on the game.

<spoilers for the begining>
the story is an amazing story starting with you as a newly hired scientist when everything goes wrong

I think this is a good way to start a shooter at the time it was straight into the action but this game starts of with a show case of the areas you are going to explore. 
But if you are playing the game because of its graphics I would better recommend black mesa by crowbar collective, I would recommend playing the original then playing black mesa to have the true expirience of half life.

ずうっと昔、ソースネクストでしたか、日本語版が出ていて、少しやった覚えがあります。（齢が分かっちゃうなあ、恥ずかしい。）確か建物の中の穴から三つ首の竜（？）が出るところ辺までやったような記憶がありますが、途中でやめちゃったんで、ハッキリしません。文字通りの名作ですが、英語版だってストーリーの細かい講釈など、気にすることはありません。某研究所で、怪しい新生物の研究をしてるところへ送り込まれた、テスト要員の主人公が、防護服を所内で手に入れ、実験場へ入り、電源を入れ、作動した中央の装置に向って、小型の車をぶつけちゃえば、Half-Lifeの始まりです。（ここまでは、構わないでしょう。）あとは根気と機転あるのみです。
なんだか、咋今、某国発祥の新型コロナを思わせるような展開で、今もって新しさを感じます。
序でに余計なことを云えば、私のロールプレイイングゲーム開眼のソフトは、(有)ろまんてっくが日本語版を出したエルヴァイラでした。マニュアルの印刷が悪いので、文句をつけたら、印刷し直したものと一緒に、ヒント集をくれたもんです。昔話ですいません。このソフトはGog-Comで英語版が今出ています。（また、余計なこと！）
